description.zh-cn: 美国企业家、投资者、软件工程师、慈善家。他与保罗·艾伦一起创建微软公司，曾任微软董事长、CEO和首席软件设计师。
description.en: American entrepreneur, investor, software engineer, and philanthropist. He co-founded Microsoft Corporation with Paul Allen and formerly served as its chairman, CEO, and chief software architect.

description.zh-cn: 美国企业家，与比尔·盖茨共同创建了微软公司。
description.en: American entrepreneur who co-founded Microsoft Corporation with Bill Gates.

description.zh-cn: 一家总部位于美国的跨国科技公司，由比尔·盖茨和保罗·艾伦创立。
description.en: A US-based multinational technology company founded by Bill Gates and Paul Allen.

description.zh-cn: 美国慈善家，比尔·盖茨的前妻，比尔及梅琳达·盖茨基金会的联合主席。
description.en: American philanthropist, ex-wife of Bill Gates, and co-chair of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.

description.zh-cn: 美国律师，比尔·盖茨的父亲。
description.en: American attorney and father of Bill Gates.

description.zh-cn: 美国银行董事，比尔·盖茨的母亲。
description.en: American bank director and mother of Bill Gates.

description.zh-cn: 位于美国马萨诸塞州剑桥市的私立研究型大学。
description.en: A private Ivy League research university in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

description.zh-cn: 位于美国华盛顿州西雅图的一所私立中学。
description.en: A private school located in Seattle, Washington.

zh-cn: 比尔及梅琳达·盖茨基金会

description.zh-cn: 由比尔·盖茨和梅琳达·盖茨创办的美国私人基金会。
description.en: An American private foundation founded by Bill Gates and Melinda Gates.

description.zh-cn: 印度裔美国商业高管，现任微软首席执行官。
description.en: Indian-American business executive, current CEO of Microsoft.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国工程科学技术界的最高荣誉性、咨询性学术机构。
description.en: The highest honorary and advisory academic institution for engineering and technological sciences in the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 一家美国跨国集团控股公司。
description.en: An American multinational conglomerate holding company.

description.zh-cn: 美国商人及投资者，曾于2000年至2014年担任微软首席执行官。
description.en: American businessman and investor who served as the chief executive officer of Microsoft from 2000 to 2014.

description.zh-cn: 由比尔·盖茨和保罗·艾伦创立的早期商业合作项目，旨在读取和分析来自道路交通计数器的原始数据。
description.en: An early business partnership between Bill Gates and Paul Allen, which aimed to read and analyze raw data from roadway traffic counters.

description.zh-cn: 国际商业机器公司，是一家美国跨国科技公司。
description.en: International Business Machines Corporation, an American multinational technology corporation.

description.zh-cn: 一家位于西雅图的微型计算机硬件公司，其开发的操作系统被微软购买并发展为MS-DOS。
description.en: A Seattle-based microcomputer hardware company whose operating system was purchased by Microsoft and became MS-DOS.

description.zh-cn: 微软公司为个人计算机开发的磁盘操作系统。
description.en: A disk operating system for personal computers developed by Microsoft.

description.zh-cn: 一家美国跨国科技公司，设计、开发和销售消费电子产品、计算机软件和在线服务。
description.en: An American multinational technology company that designs, develops, and sells consumer electronics, computer software, and online services.

description.zh-cn: 由美国司法部及20个州份的检察长联合发起的针对微软公司的反垄断诉讼。
description.en: An antitrust lawsuit filed against Microsoft Corporation by the U.S. Department of Justice and the attorneys general of 20 states.

description.zh-cn: 一家由比尔·盖茨担任董事长的核能公司，致力于开发一种名为行波反应堆的新型核反应堆。
description.en: A nuclear energy company chaired by Bill Gates, focused on developing a new class of nuclear reactor called the traveling wave reactor.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的国有独资公司，由中央人民政府直接管理。
description.en: A state-owned enterprise in the People's Republic of China, directly managed by the central government.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国最高领导人，现任中国共产党中央委员会总书记、中华人民共和国主席、中央军事委员会主席。
description.en: Paramount leader of the People's Republic of China, currently serving as General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, President of the People's Republic of China, and Chairman of the Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 由严重急性呼吸系统综合征冠状病毒2（SARS-CoV-2）导致的全球大流行。
description.en: A global pandemic caused by Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

en: Government of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的国家行政机关，即中央人民政府。
description.en: The state administrative authority of the People's Republic of China, i.e., the Central People's Government.

description.zh-cn: 比尔·盖茨于1973年入学，但在大三时（1975年）退学以创办微软。
description.en: Bill Gates enrolled in 1973 but dropped out in his junior year (1975) to start Microsoft.

description.zh-cn: 在湖滨中学相识。
description.en: Met at Lakeside School.

比尔及梅琳达·盖茨基金会

description.zh-cn: 比尔·盖茨辞去微软董事长后，作为技术顾问协助新任首席执行官萨帝亚·纳德拉。
description.en: After stepping down as Microsoft's chairman, Bill Gates served as a technology advisor to assist the new CEO Satya Nadella.

description.zh-cn: 史蒂夫·巴尔默接替比尔·盖茨成为微软首席执行官。二人也曾在哈佛大学相识。
description.en: Steve Ballmer succeeded Bill Gates as CEO of Microsoft. The two had also met at Harvard University.

description.zh-cn: IBM选择与微软合作为其个人电脑开发操作系统，这对微软的早期成功至关重要。
description.en: IBM chose to partner with Microsoft to develop the operating system for its personal computer, which was crucial for Microsoft's early success.

description.zh-cn: 西雅图电脑公司将其开发的操作系统以5万美元的价格出售给微软，该系统为微软的早期成功奠定了基础。
description.en: Seattle Computer Products sold its developed operating system to Microsoft for a reported $50,000, which laid the foundation for Microsoft's early success.

description.zh-cn: 苹果电脑就Windows 2.03和3.0的用户界面起诉微软侵犯其版权，但最终败诉。
description.en: Apple Computer sued Microsoft for copyright infringement over the user interface of Windows 2.03 and 3.0, but ultimately lost the case.

description.zh-cn: 美国政府指控微软公司在操作系统和网络浏览器销售中存在垄断行为。
description.en: The U.S. government accused Microsoft Corporation of monopolistic practices in the sale of its operating system and web browser.

description.zh-cn: 作为微软的领导者，盖茨的声誉因美国政府一系列控告微软垄断的案件而受损。
description.en: As the leader of Microsoft, Gates's reputation was damaged by a series of antitrust lawsuits filed by the U.S. government.

description.zh-cn: 泰拉能源与中国核工业集团探讨关于第四代反应堆行波反应堆的建设合作。
description.en: TerraPower explored construction cooperation with China National Nuclear Corporation on fourth-generation traveling-wave reactors.

relationships.source: 比尔及梅琳达·盖茨基金会

description.zh-cn: 在2019冠状病毒病疫情期间，盖茨基金会捐助500万美元紧急款项支持中国政府的防疫工作。
description.en: During the COVID-19 pandemic, the Gates Foundation donated $5 million in emergency funds to support the Chinese government's epidemic prevention efforts.

description.zh-cn: 比尔·盖茨就新冠疫情致信习近平表达支持，习近平回信感谢。习近平在之后的会面中称盖茨为“老朋友”。
description.en: Bill Gates wrote to Xi Jinping to express support regarding the COVID-19 pandemic, and Xi replied with thanks. Xi referred to Gates as an 'old friend' in a subsequent meeting.

relationships.target: 比尔及梅琳达·盖茨基金会

description.zh-cn: 2019冠状病毒病疫情促使盖茨基金会捐款支持中国的防疫工作。
description.en: The COVID-19 pandemic prompted the Gates Foundation to donate funds to support China's epidemic prevention efforts.
